column4: I surf with this box, but I have a box in the basement, can a use a router and cable to share the connection with the box in the basement?
With a switch or a hub rather than a router, but yes.
I can't use my router?
Well, your router is probably a switch as well as a router.  They generally are, but technically there is a difference.
How many ethernet sockets does it have?
ok, let me give it a try, after getting ping and ssh working, whatt software should I be looking at?
four, plus one for a modem, which I'm not using.
You are not using the one for the modem?  So is the internet access through a different router?
I'm accessing the internet through my dialup modem on this box.
I cannot remember exactly the details, but what you want is "ip forwarding".  I'm trying to look it up now ...
roger that.
I was hoping I could do it with VNC?
What is running on the two machines?
OSs.
Ubuntu 6.06 on both of them.
Well, you could use ssh instead of vnc.  ;-)  But anyway, you shouldn't need to do that.
When you have connected the machines, try pinging each other.
Well, the next step is "echo 1 > /proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_forward", but I don't know if that is all you need to do.
roger that, let me set up the network and give it a try, thanks.
That command will set ip forwarding up once only, but if it works there is a way to do it each time at bootup.
You still there?  I found this, which you may find useful: http://www.ducea.com/2006/08/01/how-to-enable-ip-forwarding-in-linux/
roger, thanks.
